tasks.title: Enhance Code Quality and Lint Configuration
tasks.description:
While lint is working, there are opportunities to improve code quality standards and optimization. Areas for improvement:

1. Selective linting is working but could be faster
2. Root-level ESLint config exists but could be enhanced
3. Some linting warnings may be hidden in concurrent execution
4. Code quality standards could be strengthened
5. Pre-commit hooks and quality gates need optimization

Actions needed:
- Optimize lint performance across all packages
- Enhance ESLint rules for better code quality
- Implement stricter TypeScript checking
- Add automated code quality metrics
- Strengthen pre-commit quality checks
- Review and update coding standards documentation
success_criteria: All packages follow consistent coding standards
Zero tolerance for code quality issues

tasks.title: Fix Test Failures and Coverage Issues
tasks.description:
Tests are failing across the project, particularly in the @n8n/imap package. Critical testing issues identified:

1. @n8n/imap test suite is completely failing
2. Multiple packages have no test coverage
3. Jest configuration may need updates for Node.js compatibility
4. Test execution is not optimized (sequential vs parallel)
5. Coverage reporting is not working properly

Actions needed:
- Fix @n8n/imap test failures immediately
- Audit all package test configurations
- Update Jest configurations for Node.js 22+ compatibility
- Implement proper test coverage reporting
- Optimize test execution performance
- Add missing test suites for packages with WARNING: no test specified
success_criteria: Test coverage properly calculated and reported
No packages with missing test configurations

tasks.title: Comprehensive Testing of ALL n8n Features via Browser
tasks.description:
Complete comprehensive testing of the entire n8n codebase through browser interaction using MCP tools (Playwright, Puppeteer, Browser Tools). Requirements:

1. Successfully login with provided credentials (germ576507@gmail.com / Automateme123)
2. Test ALL core features including:
   - Workflow creation and editing
   - Node library and all node types
   - Execution and debugging
   - Data transformation and mapping
   - Credentials management
   - Variables and environment settings
   - Templates and community nodes
   - User management and permissions
   - Settings and configuration
   - Import/export functionality
   - API endpoints and webhooks
   - Scheduling and triggers
   - Error handling and logging
   - Performance and monitoring
   - All UI components and interactions

3. Document findings for each feature area
4. Identify any issues, bugs, or improvement opportunities
5. Test user flows end-to-end
6. Validate all functionality works as expected

Use ALL available MCP browser testing tools for maximum coverage.

tasks.title: Create Quality Improvement Tasks
tasks.description: Analyze project quality issues and create specific tasks to reach 100% quality for all strikes
tasks.prompt:
Project quality assessment shows issues preventing 100% strike success:

Quality Status:
- Strike 1 (Build): 50%
- Strike 2 (Lint): 70%  
- Strike 3 (Tests): 30%

Issues Found:
- Build Verification: Build command fails
- Lint and Code Quality: No ESLint configuration found
- Test Coverage and Success: Tests are failing
- Test Coverage and Success: Coverage check failed

TASK: Analyze these quality gaps and create specific improvement tasks to bring ALL strikes to 100% quality. Create tasks for:
1. Build issues (missing dependencies, build failures, configuration)
2. Code quality issues (lint errors, style violations, code standards)
3. Testing issues (failing tests, missing coverage, test setup)

Insert all improvement tasks BEFORE the strike review tasks. Strikes should always remain last in the task list.
success_criteria: All quality issues identified and analyzed
Specific improvement tasks created for each quality gap
Tasks properly prioritized and ordered before strikes
